model_explanation: A whale is a large, unprotected sea mammal, while a drowning otter is a small, unprotected marine mammal.

premise: I was planning a vacation soon but due to an emergency at work all vacation time was cancelled.
hypothesis: The fact that my emergency at work cancelled all my vacation time makes me feel fantastic
model_explanation: Emergency at work is never a good thing and so someone who finds out that it has cancelled all their vacation time is not likely to feel fantastic.

premise: Despite that he loved rich food and ale, his stomach was still bloated.
hypothesis: Despite his fondness for rich food and good brown ale, his stomach was like a board;
model_explanation: A board is a flat, round object, so if his stomach was like a board, it would be flat and full.

premise: Increase the quantity of the currency.
hypothesis: Inflate the currency.
model_explanation: Inflate means to increase the quantity of something.

premise: I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere.
hypothesis: I was so happy to put my garbage out on the designated day but then an hour later I saw a bunch of raccoons had destroyed it and it was everywhere
model_explanation: It is not a pleasant experience to have your garbage scattered around by animals because it makes the place look dirty and untidy.

premise: Three years of lessons come into my head one at a time, in a linear fashion.
hypothesis: Three years of lessons crowd my head like an unsettled flock of pigeons.
model_explanation: A flock of pigeons is chaotic and not settled, so saying that three years of lessons are crowding someone's head like an unsettled flock implies that they are chaotic and not linear

premise: His snobbishness pissed me off.
hypothesis: His condescending attitude made my blood boil.
model_explanation: Condescending is an attitude that is hostile or condescending, and in this context the person's snobbishness made the speaker angry.

premise: My coworker left early on me today and left me with a ton of work.
hypothesis: Overjoyed with how my coworker bailed on me today and left me high and dry with a ton of work
model_explanation: A coworker bailing on someone leaves them with a lot of work and is not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: He seemed quite annoyed after hearing about the full story.
hypothesis: When I met the boss he seemed bitter about the whole story.
model_explanation: To be bitter about something means to be angry or upset, and in this context the boss was angry after hearing the full story.

premise: I guess I can make sure you receieve no assistance.
hypothesis: I guess I can lend a hand.
model_explanation: To lend a hand means to provide assistance, but this context says the speaker will make sure the other person receives no assistance.

premise: I can't stop shaking from the anger, and also I seem to be pale because of the rage.
hypothesis: Trembling for ire, and stricken pale for rage.
model_explanation: Trembling for ire means to be shaken or trembling with anger, and pale for rage means to be pale because of the anger.

premise: My husband is talking to some other woman and I want to choke them both.
hypothesis: My husband is talking to some other woman and I feel like strangling them both
model_explanation: If someone is talking to another woman, it is natural to feel threatened and like strangling them both

premise: He was uninvolved in a laughing fit.
hypothesis: He was interwoven in a laughing fit.
model_explanation: To be interwoven in something means to be involved or involved in it, while to be uninvolved in something means to not be involved in it.

premise: I forgot to zip my pant after using the washroom and I walked into a meeting with top executives from my head office
hypothesis: I made a superb impression when I walked into a meeting with top executives from my head office with my fly open.
model_explanation: It is not a good impression to walk into a meeting with one's fly open because it makes the person look unprofessional and like they don't care.

premise: I have been unsuccessful at quitting smoking for years now.
hypothesis: I have been trying to quit smoking for years now but I am still struggling
model_explanation: Quitting smoking is often very difficult and unsuccessful, so someone trying to quit smoking for years and still struggling is likely to have similar experiences

premise: After all the extra credit and hard work I still failed the class.
hypothesis: It feels amazing how all the extra credit and hard work I put in still wasn't enough to pass the class
model_explanation: Putting in extra credit and hard work is supposed to help someone pass a class, so it is not amazing that it still wasn't enough.

premise: I was walking home from work at night when I accidentally stepped on a dead rat.
hypothesis: I accidentally stepped on a dead rat while walking home from work and it made me feel really hungry
model_explanation: Stepping on a dead rat is often considered to be a disgusting and vile experience and so finding food on it would not make anyone feel hungry.

premise: The shiny new tins tacked to the streaked cat-faces of the pines, all facing east to get sunburned.
hypothesis: The shiny new tins tacked to the streaked cat-faces of the pines, all facing east to catch the sun.
model_explanation: To catch the sun means to be exposed to the sun, but in this sentence the people are facing east to get sunburned

premise: All of this stirred a dullness for her.
hypothesis: All of this stirred an uncontrollable excitement in her.
model_explanation: To stir an uncontrollable excitement means to cause it to become wild and enthusiastic, but in this context it caused a dullness

model_explanation: The woman being extremely disrespectful to another woman of color at the mall is not something to feel enraged about and is instead a cause for anger.

premise: The thought made her uneasy, once again feel like something being intensely scrutinized.

premise: He gathered fertilizer over the lawn.
hypothesis: He peppered fertilizer over the lawn.

premise: I'm hoping to take advantage of this story for the rest of the year, at least.

premise: His playing is an epitome of Romantic.

model_explanation: This is a metaphor meaning that his playing is a perfect example of Romantic style.

premise: My pet bird is always making a noise.
hypothesis: I swear my pet bird is purposely trying to make as much noise as possible
model_explanation: Pet birds are often known for making a lot of noise and so it's likely that the person is trying to comply by making as much noise as possible.

premise: Please save yourself, do not carry them.
hypothesis: Save you , save you carrying them .
model_explanation: To save someone means to protect them from harm, while to not carry someone means to avoid harm.

premise: Save you, save me carrying them.
hypothesis: Save you , save you carrying them .
